thread.title: Video shows Harrison Ford flying dangerously close to airliner | Page Six
thread.title_full: Video shows Harrison Ford flying dangerously close to airliner | Page Six

author: Yaron Steinbuch
title: Video shows Harrison Ford flying dangerously close to airliner | Page Six
text:
Great kid. Don’t get cocky!
Newly released video shows actor Harrison Ford mistakenly piloting his single-engine plane dangerously low over an airliner with 110 people aboard at a Southern California airport.
The 45 seconds of soundless footage shows the 74-year-old “ Star Wars ” actor’s potentially serious mishap at John Wayne Airport in Orange County.
Harrison’s yellow Aviat Husky is seen on short final as an American Airlines 737 is taxiing slowly. The plane then flies above the airliner, casting its shadow over the jet before landing on a taxiway.
SEE ALSO 
FAA begins investigation into Harrison Ford plane incident 0:0 The Federal Aviation Administration launched a standard investigation into the... Ford — who as “Star Wars” character Han Solo, famously piloted the Millennium Falcon — was supposed to have landed on a runway parallel to the taxiway.
“Was that airliner meant to be underneath me?” Ford asks in previously released audio from the air traffic control tower.
American Airlines Flight 1456 departed safely for Dallas a few minutes after the flyover.
The Federal Aviation Administration is investigating the incident .
No reason has been given for why Ford made the mistake, and his publicist has not responded to requests for comment.
The aviation aficionado collects vintage planes and has a long and good record as an aviator.
But he has had several close calls and a serious accident in March 2015 when he was injured in his World War II-era trainer when its engine failed due to a carburetor problem after taking off from Santa Monica Municipal Airport, leading to a crash landing on a Los Angeles golf course.
In June 2000, he crash-landed in Lincoln, Neb., when a wind gust tossed his six-seater off the runway. He and his passenger were unhurt. And a few months earlier, he crash-landed his helicopter near Los Angeles.
Ford also had his share of aerial heroics.
In 2001, he rescued a missing Boy Scout with his chopper near Yellowstone National Park. Less than a year earlier, he rescued a dehydrated hiker in Wyoming.
